# predicate

**Instance Property**

The logical condition that determines whether the fetch includes a specific model in its results.

## Declaration

```swift
var predicate: Predicate<T>?
```

## Discussion

Use this property to replace or remove the fetch descriptor’s predicate. If the value is `nil`, any fetch using the descriptor will return all models of the associated type.

The default value is the predicate you specify when calling [doc://com.apple.SwiftData/documentation/SwiftData/FetchDescriptor/init(predicate:sortBy:)].

## Constraining the fetch

- **sortBy**: The sort descriptors that tell the fetch how to order its results.
- **fetchLimit**: The maximum number of models the fetch can return.
- **fetchOffset**: The offset of the first matching model to fetch.
- **includePendingChanges**: A Boolean value that indicates whether, when the fetch runs, it matches against currently unsaved changes in the model context.
